intro: Securidaca planchoniana, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
